titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T19:33-0400

did.abstract: This collection contains miscellaneous letters and papers relating to explorations of South America, Cuba, and Mexico; scientific investigations; Latin American antiquities and linguistics; and publications. There are also copies of 26 letters from Humboldt to Pierre Hyacinth Azais and Jules Berger de Xivrey, from originals at the Duke University Medical Center Library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: 61 letters are photostatic copies from originals in the Maryland Historical Society and the New-York Historical Society. Their use is restricted to reference.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: For articles regarding parts of this collection, see Helmut de Terra, "Alexander von Humboldt's Correspondence with Jefferson, Madison, and Gallatin," American Philosophical Society Proceedings 103 (1959): 783 and "Studies of the Documentation of Alexander von Humboldt," APS Proceedings 102 (1958): 136, 560.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Received and accessioned, 1957. See in-house shelf list for additional accession numbers and dates.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Alexander von Humboldt was a traveler and naturalist. In 1799 he traveled to Spanish America, where he explored and collected geological, zoological, and botanical specimens for five years.

odd.head: Naval History Note
odd.p: The Alexander von Humboldt Papers contain at least one letter which may be of interest to naval historians:
Humboldt, Alexander von. Letter to Matthew Fontaine Maury. n.d. Concerning his work on hydrography, refers to Gay-Lussac. 2 pages. (B H88.39).

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This collection of Humboldt’s correspondence touches on his travels throughout the Americas. Of note are his letters with prominent Americans--namely Thomas Jefferson, Rembrandt Peale, and Peter Du Ponceau--about his observations. Many letters are in French. Some have translations.
There are also other documents that relate to Humboldt’s activities, such as a record of his arrival at the Philadelphia customs house and various other letters to scientific luminaries of the day.
The APS also has photocopies and other reproductions of Humboldt’s correspondence, including letters to Albert Gallatin.

scopecontent.p: Sans Souci. A.L.S. 1p. and add. In French. Concerning his publication, Cosmos. Old Call Number: B H88.17

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Hopes that he will shortly be appointed to the Berlin university. Old Call Number: B H88.21

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p., end. In French. Mentions Heinrich Brugsch. "My health is wonderfully preserved in the midst of these sad [political] events." Old Call Number: B H88.4 no.15

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin. Photostat of L. 2p. Copy. (from copy in U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey.) Praises the New World and especially the work of the U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey. Old Call Number: B H88.5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p. and add. In French. Concerning a canal at Panama and his comments on the best route for it. Old Call Number: B H88.110

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sans Souci. Photostat of typed L. 2p. Advises him of the gold medal awarded him by Prussia. Is a member of the Berlin geographical society. Praises him. From original in Bancroft library, University of California. (see Film 870.8.) Old Call Number: B H88.26

did.unittitle: Letter to Frau Geheimräthin Ernestine von Meusebach, Potsdam

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, Photostat of A.L.S. 4p. and add. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.11 no.4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p. and add.envelope. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.20 no.1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, A.L.S. 1p. In French. Introduces a young doctor, Dr. Mundt. Friendly letter. Old Call Number: B H88.43

did.unittitle: Letter to Sir Henry Creswicke Rawlinson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, A.L.S. 2p. and add. In French. Informs him that he is now created a Knight of the Royal Order of Merit for Sciences of Prussia. Esteems his work highly. Friendly letter. Old Call Number: B H88.76

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Photostat of L. 2p. Copy. In French. Concerning Bendan and asks help for him. On same sheet as letter from Ticknor to Lieber; Nov. 17, 1853. Old Call Number: B H88.24

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Xerox of A.L.S. 4p., enc. wanting. Has come to Prussia to observe its system of education. Praises Humboldt as belonging to no one country but to mankind. Mentions his inaugural address as president of the University of Michigan. Refers to Jefferson, Madison and Gallatin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, A.N.S. 1p. (see Agassiz. Address...Humboldt, p.14.) He may have the specimen. Old Call Number: B H88a

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, A.L.S. 1p. In French. Old Call Number: B H88.64

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Photostat of A.L.S. 2p. with enc. of 2p. Encloses letter from Humboldt to Ticknor. Friendly letter. Praises Bendan. From original in H. E. Huntington Library. Old Call Number: B H88.24

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 2p., end. In French. Asks for publication on Aztec language On same sheet is reply from Jomard to Humboldt; April 6, 1854. Old Call Number: B H88.4 no.16

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L. 1p. In French. Forwards book on Aztec language to Buschmann. On same sheet as letter from Humboldt to Jomard; March 21, 1854. Old Call Number: B H88.4 no.16

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p., end. In French. Praises his works on geography. Old Call Number: B H88.4 no.17

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In German. Friendly letter. Old Call Number: B H88.30

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Xerox of A.L.S. 1p. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.101

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Recommends Paul de Layarde for position as instructor. Names book written by de Layarde. Old Call Number: B H88.65

did.unittitle: Letter to Jules Berger de Xivrey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saturday. A.L. in 3rd. P. 2p. In French. Concerning a publication on America. Old Call Number: B H88.15 no.4

did.unittitle: Letter to William de la Rive, St. Petersburg

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charlottenbourg, A.L.S. 1p. and add. In French. Hopes to visit him. Presents him with a copy of his Cosmos. Old Call Number: B H88.15 no.5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p. and add. envelope. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.20 no.2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. and envelope. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.87

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Photostat of A.L.S. 2p. In French. (from original in British Museum, Natural history.) Friendly, complimentary letter. Old Call Number: B H88.16 no.1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, A.L.S. 3p. In French. Concerning his Kosmos and Asie centrale Political news. Old Call Number: B H88.27

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 4p. In French. Mentions portrait painted by Mme Emma. [This portrait now hangs in the Corcoran Gallery, Washington, D.C. - 1957] Old Call Number: B H88.2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, A.L.S. 1p. In French. Friendly letter. Old Call Number: B H88.69

did.unittitle: Letter to Johann Karl Eduard Buschmann

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, A.L.S. 1p. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.20 no.5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In French. Concerning translation and coloring by Galuski. Old Call Number: B H88.70

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Photo. of A.L.S. 1p. and add. with 1p. of translation, printed. Praises him on his publication on meterology. Old Call Number: B H88.1

did.unittitle: Letter to Baron Feuillet de Conches, Paris

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, A.L.S. 2p. and add. In French. Thanks for Legion of Honor conferred on him. Refers to famous French scientists, such as Arago and Laplace. Old Call Number: B H88.59 no.4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. with initials. 1p. In German. Have elected him a member of the Berlinische Gesellschaft für Deutsche Sprache and wish to present to him his diploma. Old Call Number: B H88.59 No.3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostat of A.L.S. 1p. and add. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.11 no.10

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Berlin, Facsimile of A.L.S. 1p. In German with 1p.of English translation. Concerning publication of UP Philomathean society on Rosetta stone by C.R. Hale. Old Call Number: B H88.29

did.unittitle: Obituary notice for Alexander von Humboldt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostat of D. 2p. Old Call Number: B H88.11 no.18

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concord, A.L.S. 3p. (see Agassiz. Address...Humboldt, p.72.) Friendly letter. Refers to Humboldt. Printed: American Literature, vol.XLII, no.4, Jan. 1971, 546-8. Old Call Number: B H88a

did.unittitle: u n d a t e d
Address delivered on the centennial anniversary of the birth of Alexander von Humboldt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: under the auspices of the Boston Society of Natural History, by Louis Agassiz. Boston : Boston society of natural history, 1869. 107 p.: ill.; includes ms. items and engravings. I. Title. Old Call Number: B H88a

did.unittitle: Concerning difficulties with American publishers of his works

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S. 2p. In French. Old Call Number: B H88.33

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D. 1p. Old Call Number: B H88.113

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monday. A.L.S. 1p. In French. Asks if he has received Navier's publication. Old Call Number: B H88.67

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monday. A.L.S. 2p. In French. Introduces the chemist, Dr. Reich. Old Call Number: B H88.66

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monday. A.L.S. 1p. In German. Hopes he has returned from Paris well and happy. Wants enclosed material and atlas sent to Bernard von Cotta. Old Call Number: B H88.58

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tuesday. A.L.S. with initials. 2p. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.7

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wednesday evening. A.L.S. 2p. In French. Concerning Pickersgill's portraits of himself, Cuvier and Lafayette being shown in Paris. Old Call Number: B H88.56

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thursday. A.L.S. 3p In French. Will visit Arago. Proposed changes in a "Essai Politique" after experiments with Gay Lussac. Old Call Number: B H88.71

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, Jeudi [Thursday]. A.L.S. 1p. and end. In French. Invitation to dinner. Old Call Number: B H88.12

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thursday. Photostat of A.L.S. 3p. and end. In French. Concerning volcanoes. Old Call Number: B H88.11 no.7

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friday. Photostat of A.L.S. 1p. In French. Refers to Lafayette and Tracy. Old Call Number: B H88.11 no.12

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saturday. A.L.S. 1p. In French. Hopes to visit with them shortly. Old Call Number: B H88.48

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L. in 3rd. P. 1p. In French. Asks that a reply be made at 5:30. Old Call Number: B H88.55

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostat of A.L.S. 1p. In French Incomplete. Refers to Mlle Williams and Delambre. Old Call Number: B H88.35

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.13

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photostat of A.L.S. 1p. In French. States his whereabouts for a few days. Old Call Number: B H88.11 no.6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lundi. A.L.S. 1p. Remarks on engravings; Tardieu doing a good job; will soon give to Poisson his work on the Orinoco river. Old Call Number: B H88.112

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wednesday. A.L.S. 4p. In French. Concerning winds. Old Call Number: B H88.94

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wednesday. A.L.S. 1p. In French. Makes arrangements to meet with colleagues. Mentions de Werther and Arago; refers to the Institut. Old Call Number: B H88.107

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Potsdam, Friday. A.L.S. 1p. In German. Invitation to visit, with a friend. Old Call Number: B H88.82

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friday. A.L.S. 2p. In French. Asks for help on descriptions and identification of birds from Chile and elsewhere. Old Call Number: B H88.84

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In German. Old Call Number: B H88.88

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saturday. A.L.S. 4p. In French. Concerning Klaproth. Chinese and Japanese knowledge of Straits of Magellan. Old Call Number: B H88.95

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. with initials. 3p. In French. Concerning a publication on the Mexican Indians. Old Call Number: B H88.86

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In French. Fragment. Asks for funds for orphans. Old Call Number: B H88.75

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p. In French. Writes over 2,000 letters each year and is, therefore remiss in correspondence. Busy with publications of Kosmos, etc. Politics. Old Call Number: B H88.52. March 19

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monday. A.L.S. 2p. In French. Wishes to keep instruments to show Berthollet and La Place. Desires his return date from Lyons. Old Call Number: B H88.91

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thursday. A.L.S. 2p. and add. In German. Cannot help him on Arabic facts. His work on geography of Asia and Europe. Old Call Number: B H88.50
